required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinic Features and Outcome of BPD (SGBPD)
clinical_study.official_title: Clinic Features and Long-term Outcome of Different Subgroups of Brochopulmonary Dysplasia in Preterm Infants
clinical_study.source: Children's Hospital of Chongqing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: This study described the perinatal high-risk factors and clinical manifestations of the children, and compared the high-risk factors, clinical manifestations and prognosis of BPD among different clinical subtypes by comparison between groups. BPD grading was performed using the 2018 grading standard to compare the distribution of I/II/III BPD among different groups.

primary_outcome.description: Different subtype of BPD infants against the total BPD infants in corresponding group

occurence of at least one of the following: tracheostomy, continued hospitalization for respiratory reasons at or beyond 50weeks PMA; continued oxygen supplement or respiratory support beyond 12months after birth; readmission for respiratory reasons.
days between admission and first discharge
days during which the infants were given oxygen
days during which the infants were given mechanical ventilation

secondary_outcome.description: the measure of infant's head circumference, which is the occipital-frontal circumference

arm_group.description: In preterm infants(GA<32 weeks and hospital day>14 days )，infants without BPD
In preterm infants(GA<32 weeks and hospital day>14 days )，There are clinical manifestations and imaging evidence of RDS after birth, the condition is not relieved, FiO2 lasts >25%

In preterm infants(GA<32 weeks and hospital day>14 days )，There are clinical manifestations and imaging evidence of RDS after birth. FiO2<23% within 7 days, and the condition is aggravated to FiO2>25%.
In preterm infants(GA<32 weeks and hospital day>14 days )，There is no RDS performance after birth, FiO2 lasts <25%

In preterm infants(GA<32 weeks and hospital day>14 days )，Some infants who die before 36 weeks PMA (between 14 days of postnatal age and 36 weeks) due to persistent parenchymal lung disease and respiratory failure that can not be attributable to other neonatalmorbidities

study_pop.textblock: Premature infants born at <32 weeks of gestational age and the hospitalization time ≥ 14 days.

overall_official.affiliation: children's hospital of chongqiong Medical University
